page.title: 04Education - Hittisleigh
page.content: The village school at Hittisleigh Cross which opened in 1877 with a roll of 87 closed in 1952 when the number of pupils had fallen to 6. Today 10 primary school children, 5-11 years old, go to Yeoford, Spreyton or Cheriton Bishop schools. Free school transport is provided by a mini-bus to Yeoford leaving Hittisleigh Cross at 8.30 am and returning at 3.45 pm; 12 older children are sent to Queen Elizabeth Community College at Crediton; transport is provided at 8.20 am and returns at 4.45 pm. A choice of sixth-form colleges is provided by Crediton, Exeter and Okehampton. Choice is not limited to one particular school but transport is. There are no playgroups in this area but 5 children under 5 go to playgroups in Cheriton Bishop and Yeoford.
